greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Fully multiplicative with a(prime(k)) = partition(k+1).
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: If n = Product p(k)^e(k) then a(n) = Product partition(k+1)^e(k).
Multiplicative with a(p^e) = A000041(A000720(p)+1)^e. - _David W. Wilson_, Aug 01 2001
mathematica: f[p_, e_] := PartitionsP[PrimePi[p] + 1]^e; a[n_] := Times @@ (f @@@ FactorInteger[n]); Array[a, 100] (* _Amiram Eldar_, Aug 29 2019 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = my(f=factor(n)); for (k=1, #f~, f[k,1] = numbpart(primepi(f[k, 1])+1)); factorback(f); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jan 14 2021
results.author: _Marc LeBrun_, _N. J. A. Sloane_.
ext: Description corrected and sequence extended by _David W. Wilson_.
